me.adaptive.arp.api

Interface IFileSystem

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAdaptiveRP, IBaseData

    public interface IFileSystem
extends IBaseData
    Interface for Managing the File System operations
    Since:
    ARP1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IFileSystem.FileSecurity
      Security attributes of file, if any.
      static class  IFileSystem.FileStorageType
      Location of the file storage.
      static class  IFileSystem.FileType
      Type of file - directory/folder or file.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface me.adaptive.arp.api.IAdaptiveRP

        IAdaptiveRP.Group

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FileDescriptor createFileDescriptor(FileDescriptor parent, java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new reference to a new or existing location in the filesystem.
      FileDescriptor getApplicationCacheFolder()
      Returns a reference to the cache folder for the current application.
      FileDescriptor getApplicationCloudFolder()
      Returns a reference to the cloud synchronizable folder for the current application.
      FileDescriptor getApplicationDocumentsFolder()
      Returns a reference to the documents folder for the current application.
      FileDescriptor getApplicationFolder()
      Returns a reference to the application installation folder.
      FileDescriptor getApplicationProtectedFolder()
      Returns a reference to the protected storage folder for the current application.
      char getSeparator()
      Returns the file system dependent file separator.
      FileDescriptor getSystemExternalFolder()
      Returns a reference to the external storage folder provided by the OS.

      • Methods inherited from interface me.adaptive.arp.api.IAdaptiveRP

        getAPIGroup, getAPIVersion

    • Method Detail

      • getSeparator

        char getSeparator()
        Returns the file system dependent file separator.
        Returns:
        char with the directory/file separator.
        Since:
        ARP1.0

      • getApplicationFolder

        FileDescriptor getApplicationFolder()
        Returns a reference to the application installation folder. This path may or may not be directly readable or writable - it usually contains the app binary and data.
        Returns:
        Path to the application folder.
        Since:
        ARP1.0

      • getApplicationCacheFolder

        FileDescriptor getApplicationCacheFolder()
        Returns a reference to the cache folder for the current application. This path must always be writable by the current application. This path is volatile and may be cleaned by the OS periodically.
        Returns:
        Path to the application's cache folder.
        Since:
        ARP1.0

      • getApplicationDocumentsFolder

        FileDescriptor getApplicationDocumentsFolder()
        Returns a reference to the documents folder for the current application. This path must always be writable by the current application.
        Returns:
        Path to the application's documents folder.
        Since:
        ARP1.0

      • getApplicationCloudFolder

        FileDescriptor getApplicationCloudFolder()
        Returns a reference to the cloud synchronizable folder for the current application. This path must always be writable by the current application.
        Returns:
        Path to the application's cloud storage folder.
        Since:
        ARP1.0

      • getApplicationProtectedFolder

        FileDescriptor getApplicationProtectedFolder()
        Returns a reference to the protected storage folder for the current application. This path must always be writable by the current application.
        Returns:
        Path to the application's protected storage folder.
        Since:
        ARP1.0

      • getSystemExternalFolder

        FileDescriptor getSystemExternalFolder()
        Returns a reference to the external storage folder provided by the OS. This may be an external SSD card or similar. This type of storage is removable and by definition, not secure. This path may or may not be writable by the current application.
        Returns:
        Path to the application's documents folder.
        Since:
        ARP1.0

      • createFileDescriptor

        FileDescriptor createFileDescriptor(FileDescriptor parent,
                                    java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new reference to a new or existing location in the filesystem. This method does not create the actual file in the specified folder.
        Parameters:
        parent - Parent directory.
        name - Name of new file or directory.
        Returns:
        A reference to a new or existing location in the filesystem.
        Since:
        ARP1.0
